description: this is the identifier for the start of the AERACK01 UDP packet
the length of the packet (not including all characters up-to the comma which follows this number)
the valid time for this packet (usually 1 second behind actual time)
indication of whether the CRIO is successfully synchronised to PTP time ( 1 = synced, 0 = not-synced )
the internal hardware temperature of the CRIO
indicates the flight number for this packet ( an "empty" string here indicates that the CRIO hasn't been assigned a flight number )
indicates whether the FPGA code is running ( a value toggling e.g. 1-0-1-0…etc shows running code, fixed value = non running )
indicates whether the realtime code is running ( a value toggling e.g. 1-0-1-0…etc shows running code, fixed value = non running )
- currently unused but for future use (boolean, therefore 0,1 )
this number starts @ zero and increments with each UDP packet - used for verification of packet stream
- indicates if a GIN connection is made, NO_DATA or GINDATA
- currently unused but for future use ( text, max string size = 6 characters )
- currently unused but for future use ( text, max string size = 6 characters )
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the velocity north (ms-1)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the velocity east (ms-1)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the velocity down (ms-1)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the aircraft track (deg)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the aircraft speed (ms-1)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the rate about longitudinal axis (degs-1)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the rate about transverse axis (degs-1)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the rate about down axis (degs-1)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the longitudinal acceleration (ms-2)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the transverse acceleration (ms-2)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the down acceleration (ms-2)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the utc timestamp from the GIN itself (secs)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the computed aircraft latitude (deg)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the computed aircraft longitude (deg)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the computed aircraft altitude (m)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the computed aircraft roll (deg)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the computed aircraft pitch (deg)
the serial data collected from the GIN representing the computed aircraft heading (deg)
